attributes.action: Stop Durham County Council cutting Teaching Assistants pay
attributes.additional_details: In May, Durham County Councillors approved controversial plans to fire 2,700 teaching assistants and re-hire them on different terms and conditions, which unions say will leave the majority out of pocket by up to 23%. This will come into effect in January 2017. These are real people supporting our children.  Don't let them be treated this way.
attributes.background:
Stop Durham County Council's plan to cut Teaching Assistants pay by up to 23%.
Teaching Assistants are currently paid little enough already, but the Council's decision to fire and rehire 2,700 Teaching Assistants on different terms and conditions will push them into poverty.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Durham County Council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Durham County Council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:

http://www.durham.gov.uk/article/1961/Petitions
